intro: Bryonia maysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore bryony, is a climbing plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squash, and is characterized by its tendrils and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into orange, spiny fruits. Its botanical features include a woody stem and a distinctive, bitter-tasting latex. It is often found in moist, shady habitats and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
